question: The etiology of seizures in this 15 month old girl is due to which of the following <image 1>
options: ['Neuronal migration defect', 'Neural tube closure defect', 'Perinatal hypoxic/ischemic event', 'Neoplasm']
description: The image appears to be a histological section of brain tissue stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). The tissue sample shows a large, irregularly shaped area with a pinkish hue, indicating the presence of cellular structures. There are several small, round, dark-stained areas within the tissue, which could represent cell nuclei or other cellular components. The overall appearance suggests a pathological condition affecting the brain tissue.
